doc:
Georges Douking https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georges_Douking 0 Georges Douking (born Georges Ladoubée; 6 August 1902 – 20 October 1987) was a French stage, film, and television actor. He also directed stage plays such as the premier presentation of Jean Giraudoux's Sodom and Gomorrah at the Théâtre Hébertot in 1943. He is perhaps best known for his role in the surreal 1972 comedy The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie. He was one of the favorite actors of the French filmmaker Pierre Chenal. Douking appeared in more than 75 films between 1934 and 1981. Georges_Douking ( born Georges_Ladoubée ; 6_August_1902 – 20_October_1987 ) was a_French_stage , film , and television_actor . He also directed stage_plays such_as the_premier_presentation of Jean_Giraudoux 's_Sodom_and_Gomorrah at the_Théâtre_Hébertot in 1943 . He is_perhaps_best_known for his_role in the_surreal_1972_comedy The_Discreet_Charm of the_Bourgeoisie . He was one of the_favorite_actors of the_French_filmmaker_Pierre_Chenal . Douking appeared in more_than_75_films between 1934_and_1981 .
